intro: Centaurea × maritima nothosubsp. maritima, commonly known as the sea holly, is a hybrid plant characterized by its distinctive blue to purple flower heads and spiny leaves. It is typically found in coastal areas and sandy soils, where it thrives in salty and well-drained conditions. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family and is known for its ability to tolerate harsh maritime environments. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological importance. This nothosubspecies is a result of natural hybridization between Centaurea maritima and other related species.
